students.author: Paul Max Klinski
repos: GITHUB REPOS CREATED DRING THE SEMSTER ONLY THE NAME NOT THE URL

algorithm.title: from-letter-to-picture
algorithm.abstract: In this project I am trying to translate the different layout types of letters to artificial coded pictures. I created this project in 2015 as part part of the course 'Steel Ant - Input/Output' at the University of Applied Science in Potsdam (Germany). We dealed with the topic generative design and became acquainted with P5.js supported by Fabian Mor√≥n Zirfas 'fabiantheblind' and also influenced by Mey Lean Kronemann.

iss.title: iss-money
iss.abstract: an data visualisation of the ISS expenses

algorithm.title: Lifelines
algorithm.abstract: Analog, Digital or Real? Lifelines is a series of various experiments with analog and digital algorithms and their adaption to an application.

iss.title: Encounters In Space
iss.abstract: Space shuttles regualarly fly to the ISS (International Space Station) to exchange team-members of the nasa's expeditions. This continous fluctuation of people results that some of them only met in space. Encounters In Space is a collection of graphics which highlighting the fact that a small amount of human beeings met eachother in cosmic space...

algorithm.title: Time Deconstruction
algorithm.abstract: Exploration of a new way to display time

iss.title: Relativity and the ISS
iss.abstract: Visualization of how the effects of relativity affect the crew members in the ISS

algorithm.title: pendots
algorithm.abstract: Pen Dots is an algorythm created through a process based on several experiments executed by humans and transcripted in p5js forming individual pens.

iss.title: hisstory
iss.abstract: hISStory is the visualisation of the history of the International Space Station.

algorithm.title: Molecular networks: Uniques generated patterns
algorithm.abstract: The molecular networks algorithm is a javascript written algorithm that generates a unique molecular-like pattern using the library p5js.

iss.title: Explore with the International Space Station
iss.abstract: The ISS travels fast around the globe, visiting numerous countries more often than you will never be able to. Follow the ISS and learn about the countries it flies over.

exercise.title: A visual representation (data visualization) of the chimical elements periodic table
exercise.abstract: How to represent something that has been represented a thousend times already? This periodic table of the chemical element is the result of an exercise intended to introduce students to the field of data visualization. I recieved a list of all chemical elements as a json dataset and the visualization is what I've done with it.
